textCN: 除了期待天空一直不會下雨，你還可以學會在雨天跳舞。
textEN: Instead of wishing for the sky to never rain, you can learn to dance in the rain.

textCN: 人生所有的點都是連結在一起的。
textEN: Every point in life is connected.

textCN: 向前看，過去讓它過去。
textEN: Look forward — let bygones be bygones.

textCN: 每件事情發生都有它的原因。
textEN: Everything that happens has its own meaning.

textCN: 時間是人際關係的衡量標準之一。
textEN: Time is one of the standards by which relationships are measured.

textCN: 生命有限，可以偶爾浪費，但不要完全浪費。
textEN: Life is limited — you may waste a little of it sometimes, but don't waste it entirely.

textCN: 相遇即是一種緣分，珍惜出現在你生命裡的人。
textEN: Every encounter is a kind of fate — cherish the people who appear in your life.

textCN: 人生也許就該像蘇軾一樣，也無風雨也無晴。
textEN: Perhaps life, like Su Shi wrote, is neither stormy nor sunny.

textCN: 破鏡無法重圓，對待與他人的關係請小心輕放。
textEN: A broken mirror can't be mended — handle your relationships with care.

textCN: 你最該認識且了解的人，是你自己。
textEN: The person you should know and understand the most is yourself.

textCN: 自己選擇的路，不一定要跪著走，也可以站起來走，或者換個舒服的方式走。
textEN: The path you chose doesn't have to be walked on your knees — you can stand and walk, or choose a more comfortable way to walk it.

textCN: 人生是拿來體驗的，不一定要拿來完美。
textEN: Life is meant to be experienced — it doesn't need to be perfect.

textCN: 我們應該要做好接受任何結果的準備。
textEN: We should be prepared to accept any outcome.

textCN: 想活成怎樣的自己，只有你自己能夠決定。
textEN: Only you can decide what kind of person you want to become.

textCN: 覺得很煩躁的時候，可以去看大自然。當感覺自己渺小的時候，就會感到心曠神怡。
textEN: When you feel irritated, go look at nature. When you feel your own smallness, you'll feel a refreshing sense of relief.

textCN: 別人在背後說你壞話，有可能你是個萬人迷，也有可能是因為你走在他們前面。
textEN: If people talk badly about you behind your back, it might mean you're charming — or that you're ahead of them.

textCN: 想要的東西就自己去爭取，你不再是個嗷嗷待哺的小孩了。
textEN: Go after the things you want — you're no longer a child waiting to be fed.

textCN: 這世界上有兩種事：不關我的事及不關你的事。
textEN: In this world, there are two kinds of matters: those that don't concern me, and those that don't concern you.

textCN: 人生像是一班列車，每個階段上車的人都不一樣：有的可以陪你到終點站，有的則會在幾站就下車了，所以珍惜在車上的時間吧。
textEN: Life is like a train — the people who get on at each phase are different. Some will stay with you until the final stop, and some will get off after just a few stations. So cherish the time shared on the train.

textCN: 先愛自己，才能愛別人。
textEN: Love yourself first — only then can you love others.

textCN: 好運跟厄運本來就各佔50%，不需要刻意放大不開心的事情。
textEN: Good luck and bad luck are each naturally 50% — there's no need to magnify unhappy things.

textCN: 對在乎的人及在乎你的人好就可以了。
textEN: Just be good to the people you care about, and the people who care about you.

textCN: 過去的事情可以放在心裡收好，沒必要一直帶著走。
textEN: You can store your past carefully in your heart — there's no need to carry it around forever.

textCN: 對自己誠實，不要連自己都要騙。
textEN: Be honest with yourself — don't lie even to your own heart.

textCN: 有些事情需要開始做才會有進展，不是等準備好了才開始。
textEN: Some things only make progress after you begin — don't wait until you think you're fully ready.

textCN: 我們的時間很寶貴，不要浪費在不重要的人身上。
textEN: Our time is precious — don't waste it on people who don't matter.

textCN: 當所有人都在反對你的時候，請你不要連自己都責怪。
textEN: When everyone is against you, please don't blame yourself too.

textCN: 有些事情是沒有答案的，不要太過於執著，那樣會很累。
textEN: Some things simply have no answers — don't cling too tightly, or you'll exhaust yourself.

textCN: 沒有什麽東西是永恆不變的，唯一不變的東西就是改變本身。
textEN: Nothing is truly permanent — the only thing that never changes is change itself.

textCN: 無論你做的再好，總會有人討厭你。你要做的不是討好他們，而是把重心放在那些支持你的人。
textEN: No matter how well you do, there will always be people who dislike you. What you should do is not please them, but put your focus on those who support you.

textCN: 不要只是數著日子過，試著讓每一天都有意義吧。
textEN: Don't count the day, make the days count.

textCN: 保持善良，那不需要花你半毛錢。
textEN: Be kind. It costs nothing.

textCN: 處在不適合的群體，不是想著要怎麽變成像他們一樣，而是去尋找下一個更合適的群體。
textEN: When you're in a group that doesn't suit you, don't think about becoming like them — instead, look for a group that fits you better.

textCN: 你做的每一個決定都需要承擔它所帶來的後果，做之前請三思。
textEN: Every decision you make comes with consequences — think carefully before you act.

textCN: 我們很常預設別人會怎麽看我們，但有時候事實並不像我們想的那樣，放輕鬆。
textEN: We often assume how others will see us, but reality isn't always what we imagine — relax.

textCN: 人的付出具有稀缺性，越稀少越珍貴，付出的同時注意別讓自己掉價了。
textEN: What you give has scarcity — the rarer it is, the more valuable it becomes. While giving, make sure you don't devalue yourself.

textCN: 我們不需要每天都很正向，請允許自己擁有各式各樣的情緒。
textEN: We don't need to be positive every day — allow yourself to have all kinds of emotions.

textCN: 情緒平復、獲得能量之後，接下來應該要找尋實際的解決方法，而不是停留於此。
textEN: After calming down and rebuilding your energy, you should seek actual solutions — don't stay stuck at the emotional stage.

textCN: 人生本來就是不公平的。
textEN: Life is inherently unfair. If you want fair, then go funfair.

textCN: 有誤解就要說出來，沒有人會讀心術。
textEN: If there's misunderstanding, speak it out — no one can read minds.

textCN: 多出門曬點太陽，就不會覺得自己是溫室裡的爛草莓，被兇一下就玻璃心碎。
textEN: Go outside and get more sunlight — you won't feel like a fragile greenhouse strawberry that shatters emotionally the moment someone scolds you.

textCN: 記錄一天中認為開心或幸運的事情，這一天過得也不算太糟。
textEN: Record the things that made you happy or lucky today — then the day won't feel so bad after all.

textCN: 對待重要的人事物，要用心。
textEN: Treat the people and things that matter with heart.

textCN: 每個人的想法都是獨一無二的，也正因為如此，我們必須要站在對方的角度才能看清事情的全貌。
textEN: Everyone's thoughts are unique — and because of that, we must learn to stand in others' shoes to see the full picture.

textCN: 改變自己比改變別人還要容易。
textEN: Changing yourself is easier than changing others.

textCN: 你可以不認同對方，但起碼要尊重。
textEN: You don't have to agree with someone, but at the very least, show respect.

textCN: 道歉是承認自己的錯誤，而不是索取他人的原諒。
textEN: An apology is acknowledging your own mistake — not demanding forgiveness from others.

textCN: 感激他人的付出，因為大家的時間都很寶貴。
textEN: Be grateful for others' efforts — because everyone's time is valuable.

textCN: 很私人的煩惱，傾訴給幾個人知道就好，沒有必要告知天下。
textEN: Private worries only need to be shared with a few close people — there's no need to announce them to the world.

textCN: 如果你身邊有沒事也會想起你的朋友，請你好好珍惜這樣的人。
textEN: If you have friends who think of you even when nothing is happening, treasure them well.

textCN: 來日方長，美好的事情需要等待。
textEN: Good days are long ahead — beautiful things take time to arrive.

textCN: 我們不能期待計劃能完美實現，有時候會趕不上變化，所以隨機應變的能力挺重要的。
textEN: We can't expect every plan to unfold perfectly. Sometimes reality changes faster than we expect, so adaptability is really important.

textCN: 把你身邊的人都當成一面鏡子，他們會是你人生參照及調整的對象。
textEN: Treat the people around you as mirrors — they become the references and adjustments of your life.

textCN: 强者從不抱怨環境，是金子總會發光，你其實沒那麽多藉口。
textEN: The strong never complain about their environment — if you're gold, you will shine. You actually don't have that many excuses.

textCN: 人非聖賢，孰能無過。對他人好一點，不要那麽刻薄，因為你也會有犯錯的時候。
textEN: People are not saints — everyone makes mistakes. Be kinder to others; don't be so harsh, because you too will make mistakes.

textCN: 時間不會沖淡一切，學會跟過去的自己和解，正視自己的內心感受。
textEN: Time doesn't erase everything — learn to reconcile with your past self and face your real feelings.

textCN: 人比人是比不完的，要比就跟自己比。
textEN: Comparing yourself to others never ends — if you must compare, compare with your past self.

textCN: 轉念是個神奇的東西，有時候根深蒂固的念頭轉一下事情就順了。
textEN: A shift in thought is a magical thing — sometimes when a deeply rooted mindset switches, everything starts to flow.

textCN: 別去猜測對方的想法，你永遠得不到一個正確答案，甚至他可能也不清楚自己在想什麽。
textEN: Don't assume you can guess what others are thinking — you'll never get a fully correct answer, and sometimes they themselves don't even know what they're thinking.

textCN: 如果你對某件事情有很高的期待，請同時也要做好事情不如預期的準備。
textEN: If you have high expectations for something, you should also be prepared for the outcome to fall short.

textCN: 有種藝術不是藝術家也可以學會，叫說話的藝術。
textEN: There's a kind of art that even non-artists can learn — the art of speaking.

textCN: 愛要及時，因為你無法預測你愛的人什麽時候會離開你。
textEN: Love needs to be timely, because you never know when the person you love might leave you.

textCN: 時刻培養我們的韌性，在面對挫折的時候才不會一折就斷。
textEN: Keep building your resilience, so you won't break easily when you face setbacks.

textCN: 很多東西講求剛剛好。太多不好，太少也不好，剛剛好就好。
textEN: Many things are about just right. Too much is bad, too little is bad — just right is best.

textCN: 當出現一個質疑的聲音時，那有可能是某人的主觀意見，可以不予理會。但這種聲音開始變多的時候，就需要審視一下自己了。
textEN: When there's only one voice of doubt, it could just be someone's subjective opinion — you can ignore it. But when those voices start increasing, that's when you should re-examine yourself.

textCN: 登高才能望遠，目光放遠一點，格局打開一點，不要局限在眼前的利益。
textEN: You can see farther only when you stand higher. Broaden your perspective; don't be limited by short-term gains.

textCN: 別人是別人，而你是你。你在過你的人生，不是別人的。
textEN: Others are others, and you are you. You're living your life, not theirs.

textCN: 心情低落時，應該先處理情緒再出發，不要忽略你的感受。
textEN: When you're feeling down, deal with your emotions before moving forward. Don't neglect how you feel.

textCN: 也許有些人只會陪你到某個階段，無論再怎麽緊握也沒用。
textEN: Some people are only meant to accompany you for certain stages in life. No matter how tightly you hold on, it won't change that.

textCN: 參考對象不應該以極端值做標準，因為不是每個人都是祖克柏，輟學一定會成功。
textEN: You shouldn't use extreme cases as your reference points — not everyone is Mark Zuckerberg, and dropping out definitely doesn't guarantee success.

textCN: 真正厲害的人大多是很低調的，他們不會到處告訴別人自己有多厲害。
textEN: People who are truly capable tend to be low-key. They don't need to go around telling others how great they are.

textCN: 多出去走走，看看其他人都在做什麽，避免閉門造車。
textEN: Go out more — see what others are doing — so you won't end up working blindly behind closed doors.

textCN: 有時候我們需要踢到鐵板以後才會銘記於心。
textEN: Sometimes we only truly learn our lesson after we've hit a wall.

textCN: 犯錯哪會可恥？你最好不要犯兩次同樣的錯誤。
textEN: There's nothing shameful about making mistakes. Just don't make the exact same one twice.

textCN: 「我這麽做是為了你好」這句話很爛，因為別人不可能完全知道到底什麽對我們是好，什麽是不好，那只有我們自己知道。
textEN: "I'm doing this for your own good" is such a terrible line — because no one else could ever fully know what's good or bad for us. Only we know that.

textCN: 有些話換個說法會讓對方聽了比較舒服，但其實是同樣的意思，可以達到一樣的效果。
textEN: Sometimes rephrasing the same meaning makes it easier for others to accept — but it can still achieve the same effect.

textCN: 心情可以很糟糕，但對待事物的心態絕不能崩潰。哪怕是崩潰了也不要困在這種感受太久。
textEN: Your mood can be terrible, but your attitude toward life can't collapse. And even if it collapses, don't stay in that feeling for too long.

textCN: 打壓、歧視、看不起別人，不會讓你比較高尚，就只是比較沒修養罷了。
textEN: Putting others down, discriminating, looking down on people — it won't make you more noble; it only makes you less cultivated.

textCN: 做自己跟沒有禮貌只有一線之隔。
textEN: There's a very thin line between being yourself and being disrespectful.

textCN: 進度是可以慢慢累積的，每天一點點總比沒有來得好。
textEN: Progress can be built little by little. A tiny bit every day is still better than none.

textCN: 魔鬼都藏在細節裡，請不要忽略它們。
textEN: The devil is in the details — don't ignore them.

textCN: 你只會看到社群上的人光鮮亮麗的樣子，所以也不需要太羡慕別人的生活。
textEN: What you see on social media is only people's glamorous side, so there's no need to envy their lives too much.

textCN: 勿忘初心，別忘記你為何而開始。
textEN: Don't forget your original intention — remember why you started.

textCN: 學會做人或許是這輩子最大的課題之一。
textEN: Learning how to be a decent human being might be one of the biggest lessons of this lifetime.

textCN: 一言既出，駟馬難追。話在說出去之前請三思。
textEN: Once a word is spoken, it's hard to take back — so think twice before you say it.

textCN: 最卑微的付出不是沒有任何報酬，而是你連一句謝謝都得不到。
textEN: The lowest form of giving isn't the one without reward — it's the one where you don't even get a simple "thank you."

textCN: 遇到不講理的人，繞過他就好了，畢竟吵贏他也不會讓你的戶頭多一萬塊。
textEN: When you meet unreasonable people, just walk around them — even if you win the argument, it won't magically put money into your bank account.

textCN: 勿以善小而不為，勿以惡小而為之。
textEN: Do not stop doing good deeds just because they seem small; do not commit bad deeds just because they seem small.

textCN: 人生沒有那麼多早知道。
textEN: Life doesn't give you that many chances to say "I should've known."

textCN: 沒有做過的事就不需要為它辯解，清者自清。
textEN: If you didn't do something, you don't have to defend yourself — the truth defends itself.

textCN: 你的成就應該由你做過的客觀事實來奠定，而不是靠他人的三言兩語。
textEN: Your achievements should be built upon what you've actually done — not on what others say about you.

textCN: 努力的工作，也要努力的玩。
textEN: Work hard, but play hard too.

textCN: 有些事情其實沒說要原諒，只是覺得算了。
textEN: Sometimes forgiveness isn't really given; it's just deciding to let things go.

textCN: 你應該通過自己的眼睛去認識對方，而不是通過別人的嘴巴。
textEN: You should see people through your own eyes, not through someone else's words.

textCN: 糾結在一個沒辦法控制的事物上只會讓自己更痛苦。
textEN: Obsessing over something you can't control will only make you suffer more.

textCN: 要達成一件事情或一個目標，就要付出相對的代價，天下沒有不勞而獲的事。
textEN: To achieve something, you must pay the price — nothing in this world comes for free.

textCN: 羅馬不是一天建成的，成功也不是一蹴而就的。至於怎樣才叫成功，你可以自己定義。
textEN: Rome wasn't built in a day, and neither is success. As for what counts as "success," you get to define it yourself.

textCN: 大事化小，小事化無。
textEN: Turn big problems into small ones, and small ones into none.

textCN: 可以生氣也可以難過，但記得要在今天把情緒消化完，不要帶到明天。
textEN: It's okay to be angry or sad, but remember to process those emotions today — don't carry them into tomorrow.

textCN: 別人的嘴巴長在他們身上，我們沒辦法決定他人要說什麽，但我們可以決定自己要聽什麽。
textEN: You can't control what others say, but you can choose what to listen to.
